alert.note: Alert for Dallas (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 27 at 9:11PM CDT until March 31 at 11:19AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Alabama River At Montgomery affecting Autauga, Elmore, Dallas, Montgomery and Lowndes Counties. Alabama River At R.F. Henry Lock and Dam affecting Dallas, Lowndes and Autauga Counties. Alabama River At Selma affecting Dallas County. .Flooding continues on the Alabama River and a flood warning remains in effect. The Alabama River at Selma is forecast to crest just below moderate flood stage. Another statement will be issued by Tuesday morning, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING TO LATE FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Alabama River At Selma. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening to late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Pasture lands below Selma become flooded. At 45.0 feet, Extensive overflow of low lying lands in the area begins. Some low roads in the area begin to flood. At 48.0 feet, Flooding occurs inland to between Johnson Street and Old Montgomery Road in Selmont. Portions of Bloch Park and the Selma Country Club begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Monday the stage was 35.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Wednesday evening to a crest of 47.6 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 45.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
